summary: This is a service request ticket (SR #25765) from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, reporting a technical issue with lagging security camera feeds in the Control Launch Application. The request was created on October 3, 2019, and assigned to technicians Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Assigned to address the technical service request regarding lagging security cameras at the MCC New York facility.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Assigned alongside Jeff Cranor to address the technical service request regarding lagging security cameras at the MCC New York facility.

events.title: Service Request for Camera Lag at MCC New York
events.description: A service request (#25765) was created to address severe video lag when viewing multiple IP cameras from the Control Application at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

keyFacts: The document is a service request for the Federal Bureau of Prisons' Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The request, dated October 3, 2019, reports a consistent technical problem: severe video lag when viewing multiple IP cameras from the Control Application.
The problem was affecting the workstation running the Control Launch Application at the main location, 150 Park Row, New York, NY.
The request was assigned to service technicians Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie for resolution.
The system in question was under a service contract and was not reported as an emergency.
